snippet: Royal College and St. Thomas’ College, bastions of privilege that have groomed Sri Lanka’s leaders for nearly two centuries, have competed in cricket every March for 136 years.
abstract: Colombo Journal; annual cricket match between prestigious Sri Lankan schools Royal College and St Thomas' College has been played every March for 136 years, longest continuous cricket rivalry in world; celebration of match in 2015 has added resonance in light of the large number of of Royal College alumni in Sri Lanka's government, including Prime Min Ranil Wickremesinghe.
lead_paragraph: Royal College and St. Thomas’ College, bastions of privilege that have groomed Sri Lanka’s leaders for nearly two centuries, have competed in cricket every March for 136 years.

headline.print_headline: A Cricket Match, With Politics in the Spotlight
headline.main: A Cricket Match, With Politics in the Spotlight
